Please note: this repo is archived and the Shiny app here has been moved inside [the {dehex} package](https://www.rostrum.blog/2021/08/10/dehex/), where it can be called using the `dh_app()` function.

Former README content:

>This is a work-in-progress Shiny app to help you learn how to assess a colour hex code, e.g. #F54A88. The app is built around the {dehex} package ([source](https://github.com/matt-dray/dehex), [blog](https://www.rostrum.blog/2021/08/10/dehex/)), which follows [David DeSandro's method](https://metafizzy.co/blog/read-color-hex-codes/) for learning how to assess hex codes by eye.
